themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text is a formal resolution (psephisma) passed by a city in response to an embassy from Magnesia, as indicated by the terms 'psephisma' and 'dedochthai'.

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The inscription details the regulations for the sacrifice, festival, and sacred truce dedicated to Artemis Leukophryene.
themes.quote: θυσίαν καὶ πανήγυ[ρι]ν καὶ ἐ[κεχειρίαν καὶ ἀ]γῶνα μουσι[κόν] τε καὶ γυμνι[κὸν καὶ ἱ]ππικόν

themes.label: Agonistic / Victory Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The text mentions the establishment or recognition of musical, gymnastic, and equestrian competitions (games).
themes.quote: ἀγῶνα μουσι[κόν] τε καὶ γυμνι[κὸν καὶ ἱ]ππικόν

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The decree specifies the amount of money (300 drachmas) to be paid to the theoroi for their mission and travel expenses.
themes.quote: δραχμὰς τριακοσίας καὶ μισθὸν [τὸν εἰ]ς πο--ον μερῶν τριάκοντα

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The text describes the process of electing three theoroi (sacred ambassadors) from the citizen body.

rationale: This decree concerns the recognition of the asylia (inviolability) of Magnesia on the Maeander and the acceptance of the panhellenic games (Leukophryena) in honor of Artemis Leukophryene. It details the appointment of theoroi (sacred envoys), their travel allowance, and the hospitality (xenia) provided to the Magnesian ambassadors at the Prytaneion.
